Description: The hermit Saints Anthony and Paul; on the left St Paul resting upon a trunk and holding a book, on the right St Anthony sitting asleep, a rocky landscape beyond. c.1500 Engraving
Curator's comments: This engraving was catalogued by Hind among a group of miscellaneous north Italian prints from about 1460-1500. It seems a product of the North East Italian school, somewhat in the manner of the Vicentine artist Benedetto Montagna. The BM has another impression of the print (P&D 1895-9-15-69); other impressions are in Paris; Florence (Biblioteca Marucelliana); Vienna.
Bibliographic references: Hind 1938-48 / Early Italian Engraving, a critical catalogue (E.III.78)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Representation of: St Paul the Hermit
